div.l: For ofte tyme / he foond his box ful bare
For euery other day his boxe was lefte bare
For sikerly / a prentys reuelour
An vnthrysty begynnyng for yong or for olde
That haunteth dees / ryot or paramour
A Prentyse to be a reueloure ⁊ peramours to holde
His maister / shal it in his shoppe abye
That bargeyn no man so sore schalle Abye
Al haue he / no part of the Minstralcye
For as hit is seyd in þe bible
As his Maister þat hath no parte of his melodye
For thefte and riot / they been conuertible
Al konne he pleye / on Giterne / or Rubible
And þerto he bereth a lecherous eye
Reuel and trouthe / as in a lowe degree
They been ful wrothe al day / as men may see
When þy purs is penyles where schalt þou haue more
Thou þat wylt not þe ottupie no thyng therfore
Revel ys ordeyned to hem þat mow pay
But prentise ne pore man þey mowe not away
Euelle sponne wolle at the laste wolle come oute
They þou kepe it neuer so prevey in alytelle cloute
¶ This ioly Prentys / with his Maister bood
Til he were neigh / out of his prentishood
Al were he snybbed / bothe erly and late
And som tyme / lad with reuel to Newgate
Where he his vnthriftynes sore aboughte
But atte laste / his maister hym bithoghte
Vpon a day / whan he his papir soghte
To over se his papire ⁊ hym thorow sought
Of a prouerbe / that seith this same word
Wel bet is roten Appul / out of hoord
